channel.title: Hosting Issues Please Help
channel.description:
Ok, so I am trying to open my server privately to friends. It is the Project Dungeonfest source. This is the first revision above a 508 that I have tried opening so I am having some difficulties.
Things that I have done= 1. I have changed the server ip "127.0.0.1" to my desired ip address. (and compiled) 2. I have no-ip running. I have the duc downloaded and I have my server host checked. 3. (This is were I think I may be messing up) I have a Linksys Cysco Router. I have Port forwarded but there are two possible places to port forward with my router. I am in gaming and applications, and there is a section called "single port forwarding" and " range port forwarding" I have tried them both and have had no luck.
- I don't know if it is my no-ip account or what but I could really use some help. Any suggestions? Thanks

item.title: Hosting Issues Please Help
item.dc:creator: @nolan2131 nolan2131
item.description:
@nolan2131 wrote:

sec lemme check my pm’s I may have cleared the inbox without looking. <-- Yea I’m sorry bro, I accidentally must have cleared my inbox since its oldest message is from yesterday. I clear my inbox quite frequently, and must have deleted the message. I was looking forward to that server as well. It really does make me look like a douche if I applied to help and then blew it off. I apologize, good luck bro.

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting Issues Please Help
item.dc:creator: @nolan2131 nolan2131
item.description:
@nolan2131 wrote:

Ok, so I am trying to open my server privately to friends. It is the Project Dungeonfest source. This is the first revision above a 508 that I have tried opening so I am having some difficulties.

Things that I have done=

  1. I have changed the server ip “127.0.0.1” to my desired ip address. (and compiled)
  2. I have no-ip running. I have the duc downloaded and I have my server host checked.
  3. (This is were I think I may be messing up) I have a Linksys Cysco Router. I have Port forwarded but there are two possible places to port forward with my router. I am in gaming and applications, and there is a section called “single port forwarding” and " range port forwarding" I have tried them both and have had no luck.
  • I don’t know if it is my no-ip account or what but I could really use some help. Any suggestions? Thanks
